thread.title: Vacation Fulfillment Highlights a September Vacation in Savannah
thread.title_full: Vacation Fulfillment Highlights a September Vacation in Savannah

author: Media Relations
title: Vacation Fulfillment Highlights a September Vacation in Savannah
text:
Labor Day Weekend is the perfect time to wrap up summer with a vacation and Vacation Fulfillment is ready to help make a trip to beautiful Savannah a reality. This coastal town always has something going on, and in September the weather is perfect to spend plenty of time outside. 1. Bacon Fest – Attention bacon lovers! Come on down to Rousakis Riverfront Plaza for the second annual Bacon Fest. This year, on September 4th and 5th enjoy bacon, bacon, and more bacon. Participating restaurants will be serving up their most creative bacon dishes all weekend. The festival will combine with First Fridays and Fireworks presented by Wet Willie’s and will begin at 9:30pm. Regional vendors will have their wares on display for souvenir shopping.
2. Dinner Cruise – Cruise back in time on the Gullah Heritage Dinner Entertainment Cruise. Enjoy the stories, dance, and music of the Geechee Gullah Tribe by the renowned Geechee Gullah Ring Shouters. Vacation Fulfillment notes that these Ring Shouters hold the Guinness World Record for the largest ring shout. These direct descendants of American slaves are ready and willing to share their history and culture. A delicious, Southern buffet will tantalize taste buds on this cruise where culture and culinary delights converge.
3. Brew Fest – After a stop at the Bacon Fest, head on over to the 8th Annual Savannah Craft Brew Fest. Held each year over the Labor Day Weekend, this event has grown and will include indoor and outdoor Beer Gardens, Import and Cider Gardens, as well as a Mixology Garden featuring beer cocktails. Other fun things to do include a Cornhole Tournament, Mead Garden, and Silent Disco. The Sam Adams Brew University will also be in attendance conducting a variety of educational demonstrations.
4. Beach Bash – Cool ocean breezes waft through the air on Tybee Beach Pier and Pavillion. Live music fills the air on September 6th as the Annual Labor Day Beach Bash returns. Fireworks will fill the night sky at about 9:15 on Sunday and are visible from the pavilion or any of Tybee’s eastern beaches. Bring a lawn chair or a blanket and put this enjoyable ocean evening on the calendar.
From festivals to cruises and a relaxing evening, there is so much to experience in Savannah, Gerogia. Contact Vacation Fulfillment today to arrange a Savannah Labor Day Weekend adventure.
